casebody.data:
Oakley v. Gardiner et al. (Supreme Court, General Term, Second Department. February 11, 1891.) Appeal from special term, Kings county. Action by Rosalie Adele Oakley against J. Lyon Gardiner and others. There was a judgment for plaintiff, and defendants appeal.

Argued before Barnard, P. J., and Dykman and Pratt, JJ.

W. J. Foster, for appellants. Hatch & Warren, for respondent. Barnard, P. J.

This ease is governed by the decision in the foregoing case. This is an action for an injunction to prevent the delivery of a deed for the premises sold for the assessment. The case rests upon the same construction of the statute as was presented by the case of People v. Bleckwenn, ubi supra. Judgment affirmed, with costs.
